message.content:
cs.IR, cs.HC, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG 

The paper is primarily focused on information retrieval (IR) and proposes a new theoretical framework for retrieval in dynamic scenarios. Therefore, cs.IR is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the observable user signal and search intent, which are related to human-computer interaction (HCI) and natural language processing (NLP), respectively. Hence, cs.HC and cs.CL are also likely sub-categories. The proposed framework involves optimizing a utility function, which is a common approach in artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML). Therefore, cs.AI and cs.LG are also possible sub-categories.
